column2: RHODE ISLAND DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Rhode Island
column6: RI

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers should always signal when:
column4: changing lanes.
column6: pulling into traffic from a parking area or alley.
column8: pulling out of a parking space.

column2: 2. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the solid line may pass.
column6: next to the broken line may pass.
column8: in both directions may pass.

column2: 3. To prevent a fatigue-related crash while driving:
column4: continue driving so you will reach your destination sooner.
column6: drive at night when there are not as many vehicles on the roadway.
column8: find a safe parking area to take a 15 to 20 minute nap.

column2: 4. If your vehicle has a mechanical problem, you should:
column4: turn on your hazard lights and pull off the road.
column6: signal and pull into the slow lane.
column8: stop in your lane and put on your emergency flashers.

column2: 5. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column6: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: reduce the minimum following distance.
column10: keep less space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 6. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column8: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.

column2: 7. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: what is not allowed.
column6: the law.
column8: the direction they should travel.
column10: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 8. It is legal to make a left turn at a red light after stopping if:
column4: you yield to all other traffic at the intersection before proceeding.
column6: you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.
column8: you are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Roundabout ahead. Slow down.

column2: 10. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column6: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.
column8: Danger ahead.

column2: 11. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column6: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column10: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.

column2: 12. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column4: stop.
column6: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.
column8: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.

column2: 13. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.
column8: look and listen for trains.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Four-lane traffic ahead
column6: Intersection ahead
column8: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 15. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Yield.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 16. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column4: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.
column6: during daylight hours only.
column8: when making turns.

column2: 17. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column6: go to work.
column8: stop if necessary.

column2: 18. Who is most at risk?
column4: Long-distance commuters.
column6: Drivers who are fatigued.
column8: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 19. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: a divided highway is ahead.
column6: they cannot go straight ahead.
column8: left and right turns are not allowed.
column10: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Detour
column6: Limited parking
column8: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: No Right Turn
column6: Stop Sign Ahead
column8: No U-turns
column10: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 22. On two-lane, two-way streets or highways, you should start left turns close to the center line.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 23. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Alcohol does not
column6: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column8: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05
column10: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit

column2: 24. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: turn left into the one-way road.
column8: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column10: make a U-turn into the two-way road.

column2: 25. A pedestrian starts to cross in front of your vehicle. You should:
column4: speed up and pass in front of the pedestrian.
column6: stop until the person is out of the crosswalk.
column8: sound your horn and proceed with caution.
